data.name: contact
data.value:
If you still have questions or want to contact us, please use the following methods:
  • message Facebook/Messenger if you have us as a contact.
  • perm_phone_msg Whatsapp/call: +46 79 305 78 28 (Yen Chiou) & +46 73 598 71 34 (Antonio).
  • email Email: yenchiou@hotmail.com (Yen Chiou) & antonio.carrillo.ce@gmail.com (Antonio)

data.name: faq_answer1
data.value: There is no dress code for our wedding, feel free to wear anything comfortable. However, in spain, people normally dress up for example suit and tie for men and dress for women.

data.name: faq_answer2
data.value: Both Madrid and Barcelona have international airports, which should be the most convenient. However it depends on your plan if you would like to visit other countries in Europe.

data.name: faq_answer3
data.value: Most of the spanish cannot converse well in English but they are very friendly and willing to help.

data.name: faq_answer4
data.value:
The wedding will be a combination of Spanish and Malaysian Chinese traditions. The approximate schedule would be:
  • Civil ceremony in one of the Castles rooms.
  • Tea ceremony.
  • Pre-dining cocktail (informal standing snacks with drinks).
  • Dining.
  • Party with music. Alcohol included.

data.name: faq_question1
data.value: What is the dress code for the wedding?

data.name: faq_question2
data.value: Where should i fly to if I depart from Malaysia?

data.name: faq_question3
data.value: How can I communicate with Spanish people?

data.name: faq_question4
data.value: What type of wedding it is?

data.name: faq_text
data.value: We want everyone to feel confortable in the wedding and to have a good time. But since Malaysian-Spanish weddings are not a common thing you might have some questions...

data.name: info_where_text
data.value: In the Castle of Santiago. In Sanlúcar de Barrameda, Cádiz, Spain.

data.name: timeline_1_text1
data.value: Antonio was born in Sevilla and lived there with his parents and his two sisters until he moved to Poland to study Erasmus.

data.name: timeline_1_text_2
data.value: Shy kid and obsessed with football.

data.name: timeline_2_text
data.value: Born in Ipoh and live in Sungai Siput (U) until she moved to Gothenburg. Very shy and little kid, love to play ping pong. She is always mistaken as a malay due to her dark skin.

data.name: timeline_3_text1
data.value: After meeting in SFI (swedish for intruders), we start dating.

data.name: timeline_3_text2
data.value: At SFI Antonio hates Yen Chiou, but then he tries to look cool on the dates.

data.name: timeline_4_text
data.value: Yen Chiou moved to Kristiansund (Norway) for work. She lived there for 9 months and in order to live there, she has Swedish driving license. (one of her biggest achievements in sweden :-) ) . Yen Chiou thinks that Gothenburg weather is great after living in Kristiansund.

data.name: timeline_5_text
data.value: Finally Yen Chiou comes back to Gothenburg, and we deicede to start living together. Here starts our noghtmare in the Swedish renting market.

data.name: timeline_6_text
data.value: Yen Chiou finally convinces Antonio to buy an apartment. The search is tough but we manage to move to our own place. Removing wallpaper is a terrible experience but we manage to put together a couple of rooms.

data.name: timeline_7_text
data.value: Antonio asks Yen Chiou to marry her in San Sebastián. He tries to be romantic but he nearly ruin it. The food in Berasategui was good, but we ended up so full and sick of so many gelatins.

data.name: timeline_text
data.value: If you got to this site, you should already know a bit about us, but here is a quick summary of how we got here.

data.name: visit_1_text
data.value: One hour from Sanlúcar you can find Algarve, the southest region of Portugal.

data.name: visit_2_text
data.value: The city were the wedding is taking place. Famous for its seafood, nice palaces and its beautiful horse race in the beach.

data.name: visit_3_text
data.value: The city were Antonio comes from. One of the most touristic places in Spain and worth a visit.

data.name: visit_4_text
data.value: A wonderful city 2 hours from Sevilla. Its moor heritage makes it a really special city.

data.name: visit_text
data.value: Since you decided to go all the way to Spain, maybe you should also spend a bit more time and visit all the wonderful places near the castle. These are some suggestions of places to visit within one hour of the wedding venue.

data.name: where_haunted_text
data.value: Some of the tourist guides and cleaning personal have reported poltergeist phenomena in the Castle. Even famous reporter Iker Jimenez made a feature on the castle: link.

data.name: where_history_text
data.value: Built between 1468 y 1492, this late Gothic castle has played a significant role in the area. The castle served as residence to the Catholic Monarchs of Spain.

data.name: where_sailors_text
data.value: Given Sanlucars strategic location, the castle has hosted illustrous explorers and sailors such as Cristopher Colombus (discovery of America) or Magallanes and Elcano (first round trip around the globe).

data.name: where_text
data.value: The wedding is taking place in a very special place, a castle. This wonderful 15th-century castle, which was restored with private funds in 2003 is one of the landmarks in Sanluucar. Among other historical events, it is known for being the place where the first trip around the world started in 1519.
